ch.lambdaj.collection

Class LambdaIterator<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.lambdaj.collection.LambdaIterator<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Iterator<T>

    public class LambdaIterator<T>
extends Object
implements Iterator<T>, Serializable
    An Iterator that extends the Iterator interface with the fluent interface methods provided by lambdaj
    Author:
    Gianfranco Tognana, Mario Fusco
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • retain

        public LambdaIterator<T> retain(org.hamcrest.Matcher<?> matcher)
        Retains all the objects in this iteraor that match the given hamcrest Matcher
        Parameters:
        matcher - The hamcrest Matcher used to retain this iterator
        Returns:
        A sublist of this iterator containing all the objects that match the given hamcrest Matcher

      • convert

        public <V> LambdaIterator<V> convert(Converter<T,V> converter)
        Converts all the object in this iterator using the given Converter.
        Parameters:
        converter - The converter that specifies how each object in the iterator must be converted
        Returns:
        A LambdaIterator containing all the objects in this iterator converted using the given Converter

      • extract

        public <V> LambdaIterator<V> extract(V argument)
        Converts all the object in this iterator extracting the property defined by the given argument.
        Parameters:
        argument - An argument defined using the Lambda.on(Class) method
        Returns:
        A LambdaIterable containing the argument's value extracted from the object in this iterator

        public T aggregate(Aggregator<T> aggregator)
        Aggregates the items in this iterable using the given Aggregator.
        Parameters:
        aggregator - The function that defines how the objects in this iterable have to be aggregated
        Returns:
        The result of the aggregation of all the items in this iterable

      • aggregate

        public <A> A aggregate(A argument,
              Aggregator<A> aggregator)
        For each item in the given iterable collects the value defined by the given argument and then aggregates them iterable using the given Aggregator.
        Parameters:
        argument - An argument defined using the Lambda.on(Class) method
        aggregator - The function that defines how the objects in this iterable have to be aggregated
        Returns:
        The result of the aggregation of all the items in this iterable

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The minimum of all the Object in the given iterable

        public <A> A sum(A argument)
        Sums the property values of the items in this iterable defined by the given argument.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The sum of the property values extracted from all the items in the given iterable

      • selectMin

        public <A> T selectMin(A argument)
        Selects the item in this iterable having the lowest value on the given argument defined using the on method.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • join

        public String join()
        Joins all the object in this iterable by concatenating all their String representation. It invokes toString() an all the objects and concatening them using the default separator ", ".
        Returns:
        The concatenation of the String representation of all the objects in the given iterable or an empty String if the iterable is null or empty

      • join

        public String join(String separator)
        Joins all the object in this iterable by concatenating all their String representation. It invokes toString() an all the objects and concatening them using the given separator. Note that this method accepts an Object in order to be used in conjunction with the Lambda.forEach(Iterable).
        Parameters:
        separator - The String used to separe the item's String representation
        Returns:
        The concatenation of the String representation of all the objects in the given iterable or an empty String if the iterable is null or empty

      • forEach

        public T forEach()
        Transforms this iterable in a single object having the same methods of a single object in this iterable. That allows to invoke a method on each T in the collection with a single strong typed method call. The actual class of T is inferred from the class of the first iterable's item, but you can specify a particular class by using the overloaded method.
        Returns:
        An object that proxies all the item in the iterator or null if the iterator is null or empty

      • forEach

        public T forEach(org.hamcrest.Matcher<?> matcher)
        Transforms the subset of objects in this iterable that match the given Mathcer in a single object having the same methods of a single object in this iterable. That allows to invoke a method on each T in the collection with a single strong typed method call. The actual class of T is inferred from the class of the first iterable's item, but you can specify a particular class by using the overloaded method.
        Returns:
        An object that proxies all the item in the iterator or null if the iterator is null or empty

      • map

        public <K> LambdaMap<K,T> map(Converter<T,K> converter)
        Maps the objects in this iterable on the value extracted using the given Converter.
        Parameters:
        converter - The converter that specifies the key on which each object should be mapped
        Returns:
        A map having as keys the argument value extracted from the objects in the given iterable and as values the corresponding objects

      • map

        public <K> LambdaMap<K,T> map(K argument)
        Indexes the objects in this iterable based on the value of their argument.
        Parameters:
        argument - An argument defined using the Lambda.on(Class) method
        Returns:
        A map having as keys the argument value extracted from the objects in the given iterable and as values the corresponding objects

      • index

        public <A> LambdaMap<A,T> index(A argument)
        Indexes the objects in this iterable based on the value of their argument.
        Parameters:
        argument - An argument defined using the Lambda.on(Class) method
        Returns:
        A map having as keys the argument value extracted from the objects in the given iterable and as values the corresponding objects

        public boolean exists(org.hamcrest.Matcher<?> matcher)
        Returns true if exists at least one item in this iterable that matches the given hamcrest Matcher
        Parameters:
        matcher - The hamcrest Matcher used to match the items in this iterable
        Returns:
        True if exists at least one item in this iterable that matches the given hamcrest Matcher, false otherwise

      • first

        public T first(org.hamcrest.Matcher<?> matcher)
        Selects the first object in this iterable that matches the given hamcrest Matcher
        Parameters:
        matcher - The hamcrest Matcher used to retain the given iterable
        Returns:
        The first object in the given iterable that matches the given hamcrest Matcher or null if there is no such object

      • unique

        public T unique(org.hamcrest.Matcher<?> matcher)
        Selects the unique object in this iterable that matches the given hamcrest Matcher
        Parameters:
        matcher - The hamcrest Matcher used to retain the given iterable
        Returns:
        The only object in the given iterable that matches the given hamcrest Matcher or null if there is no such object
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if there is more than one object that matches the given hamcrest Matcher
